thread.title: Tragic first picture of six-month-old baby who died after suffering fractured skull and mum left "broken" by tragedy - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Tragic first picture of six-month-old baby who died after suffering fractured skull and mum left "broken" by tragedy - Mirror Online

author: Emma Grimshaw
title: Tragic first picture of six-month-old baby who died after suffering fractured skull and mum left "broken" by tragedy - Mirror Online
text:
Aya Parker pictured with her mother Zosia (Photo: Bristol Post) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This is the tragic first picture of a six-month-old baby who died after suffering a fractured skull at her home. 
Aya Parker died on Christmas Day after police and paramedics were called to her home in Bristol and friends say mum Zosia has now been left "trying to rebuild her broken life". 
The Bristol Post reports Aya's father Lee Parker has been charged with her murder and is currently in custody awaiting trial. 
Her mum Zosia has left the flat on Britton Gardens where the baby died and friends have launched a fundraising campaign to help her rebuild her life. 
The Gofundme page has been set up aiming to raise Â£3,000 - but has already nearly hit this target. Police and paramedics were called to Britton Gardens on Christmas Day 
Set up by Theresa Rutter, the site says: "Please can you give generously to help Zosia try & rebuild her broken life & help pay towards a fitting commemoration of Aya's sadly short life. 
"Please can I plead with all of you who have meant to donate but just not got around to it, and others who have been thinking about it, to donate now to help reach our target in memory of Aya and to help Zosia try and rebuild her life through this terrible and difficult time." 
A statement on the fundraising page says that many of Zosia's possessions, including clothes and furniture, are still inside the flat where her daughter died. 
An Avon and Somerset police spokesperson said: "We have continued to support Aya's mother since her tragic death on Christmas Day last year. 
"Family liaison officers have been in regular contact with her and arrangements are in place for her to collect her possessions when she is ready." 
To donate to the appeal, click here . Aya's father Lee Parker, 33, has appeared before Bristol Crown Court charged with murder and is awaiting a trial, which has a provisional start date of June 26 this year. Like us on Facebook
